New Records: Derek Hill homered twice, including a 432-foot shot in the second inning, and Bryce Doyle homered to center (429 feet) in the third inning.
The Miami Marlins set their highest scoring game in the series with 12 runs.
Derek Hill became the second player in his career to hit two home runs in a single game, following a similar performance on June 14, 2023.
Key Match Events: The Marlins scored 7 runs in the fourth inning, highlighted by a sacrifice fly by Jesly Romero and a home run by Brendan Rodgers (438 feet)
The game featured multiple fielding errors by the Rockies, leading to several unearned runs for the Marlins.
The Marlins' bullpen, led by Justin Tinoco (2.1 IP, 2 H, 0 ER, 3 K), held the Rockies to 2 runs over the final 3.1 innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Marlins manager Kim Ng expressed satisfaction with the team's ability to respond after a tough loss in Game 3 and emphasized the importance of the win in their push for the playoffs.
Rockies manager Bud Black acknowledged the Marlins' strong performance and noted the need for his team to improve defensively in future games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the third and final meeting between the Marlins and Rockies in August 2024, with the series tied 2-2 before this game.
The Marlins' 12-8 victory marked their second win of the series and their highest scoring game in the four-game set.
Others: The game was played at Coors Field in Denver, Colorado, with an attendance of 20,949 fans.
